name: China Cat Sunflower -> I Know You Rider

performances.description: Dicks Picks 12 But Awesome opening Jam

performances.venue: Old Renaissance Faire Grounds Veneta, OR
performances.description: Definitive version, for sure
Absolutely flawless. Such a wonderful transition. Never-ending peaks.

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Shocking this version has not been submitted yet.  Funky and Jazzy as they come. Can't believe I never heard this one!!!
Tremendous transition into a tender Rider with moments of pure bliss! This show is amazing!!!
'74 gem...Phil and Billy are feel in' it big-time...superb transition

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Sweet later version
First ChinaCat in 3 years and the boys come out hungry with it.  Crowd goes bananas
Hard-charging drumming from Billy leads the way. Best MLB jam in this pairing I've ever heard. Hard to believe it wasn't listed yet.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: This China Cat has some serious muscle, check it out
Giddy-up
The hottest China>Rider transition Jam of '74

performances.venue: Pauley Pavilion - University of California Los Angeles, CA
performances.description: Coming from my all time favorite show this here China cat Jerry catches some fun rifts and wild noodles all over. plus uncle johns tease before rider
Fantastic China Rider from DP 36. Things get interesting when Bob decides to take a solo on the transition jam. The song just flows.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Sick Sick Sick Sick transition!!!!!!!
Wall of Sound debut version....definitely one of the finest!
Musician's music - great sharing - Bob's on Fire thru transition, phil's just on something the whole show!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Amazing later version - very high energy.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Theater Noblesville, IN
performances.description: long warm up, brent is fantastic on this version which is over the top in every way

performances.venue: Activity Center - University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: This is just sick.. period.
Peaks and flows

performances.venue: San Diego International Sports Arena San Diego, CA
performances.description: Top notch early 70s

performances.venue: Salt Palace Salt Lake City, UT
performances.description: One of the only during '73-'74 without the Feelin' Groovy jam. Really tight, groovy and bouncy.
Total sleeper!!!!  I came across this version by accident.  Good god man- everything about this is perfect! Mountain Jam taboot.  LISTEN NOW!  Damn...
China> Rider from Winter of '73?!? Yes, Please!
Rad

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Fairgrounds Arena Oklahoma City, OK

performances.description: Great transition work but Jerry delivers hot licks city on the Rider jam
Stellar version from a show that is money from end to end.  Check it.
Effortlessly smooth transition...the boys show they mean business by starting off with this little number
Mind twisting and awesome
Great UJB jam in this one...GD Movie Soundtrack version.
From DP 23...Listen to this version with headphones or turned up loud...one of my favorite pieces of Dead music!
Immense flow, wild Feelin' Groovy jam
Not exploratory but incredibly well-played. This whole show should be officially released.
Smoking

performances.venue: Roscoe Maples Pavilion - Stanford University Palo Alto, CA
performances.description: Great Wavy Gracy banter on track preceding..."The Rainbow Makers"...the boys live up to it
From the best show of all time.
Very different sounding Jerry solo! Really cool version.

performances.venue: Century II Convention Hall Wichita, KS
performances.description: Another charged version from this great year.  Bob really starts the charge at the end of the China Cat, but then Jerry finishes up the transition.
Very nicely jammed on both sides
Stark bluesy IKYR with Pigpen backing vocals - the best.
The version on "Without a Net" is pretty surprisingly absent from this list!
As Dick himself said of how this China Cat is born, "[it] is worth any effort to hear."
Hot, compact ChinaCat jam, but the highlight is Jerry hammering the "headlight" lyric in Rider. Gave me chills (as most similar later versions do)

performances.venue: Campus Stadium, UCSB Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Absolutely smoking China Cat
Final "Feelin' Groovy" jam :( but it's a good one!
Gotta love Bobby's purposely played off-key note during the intro to China Cat. Great Version.
Deserves a shot at the top 20 of all time.
Silky smooth version
Bob's Solo in the transition jam is on fire!! It took me a minute to realize it wasn't Jerry playing!

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA
performances.description: The boys were on Fire in Cape Cod
Awesome China<Rider from a great show
This one should be here.  Very different but cool transition into Rider.
Frankly, I was quite surprised upon seeing this one had yet to be posted. A seamless and absolutely sick version
Can;t explain, but real cool vive to this combo this evening.

performances.venue: Iowa Fieldhouse - University of Iowa Iowa City, IA
performances.description: Best show from best tour ever, 82' Dead, Best year ever!!!!
the build up to the feelin' groovy jam is epic! my favorite China->Rider
Doesn't dissapoint. Nice developed transition for April 72...Dreamy guitar work during this transition.

performances.venue: St. Paul Auditorium St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Seemless out of a perfect Here Comes Sunshine.  Epic flow, up-tempo, great sounding and flawless jams.  What more can a Head need?
Beautiful. One of those rare gems where the Rider seems altogether tighter than the China Cat.  What more can a head want?
Rock-solid China with Jerry twisting and pulling its melodic basis throughout a great solo + great Feeling Groovy trans. into Rider.
Super mellow and smooth, understated grace - like the rest of the first set here - and one cool '73 beauty of a transition to Rider. Overlooked!
One of the best of the '90s and a personal Top 5. One of the best transition jams ever.
Ripping Rider in this one
best China Cat solo ever, hello!
How is this not here?? Dicks picks 4... a classic primal china>rider no doubt.
maybe the best brent version.  jerry doesn't let up on the jam in between with plenty of midi

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: This one must be listed!! Pure Pig Pen Era Dead... Weir sets down an awesome groove. Transition to Rider is sublime
Very sweet version
Really tight and uptempo.  Jerry sings through a cold, but energetic and inspired guitar work.  Perfect transition into Rider.
Warning: May cause goosebumps. Bertrando's AUD is VG+.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Driven by the drummers. Gets better every time I hear it.
A complex and delicate version with a very mellow transition
Great version.  Most notable is Phil.  Love the transition...Phil and Bob lead the charge.
Complete hidden gem, superb early version

performances.venue: Folsom Field, University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: China Cat shines bright with strong transition jam - Jer belts out the headlight line in the Rider and Phil barrel rolls all through the pocket.
Superific China>Rider from a big show at Giants Stadium!!!

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: Great way to start the show!  Nice energy
laid back breezy and soulful

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: Uber TIGHT. Under the radar too, spin this one for sure if you haven't you won't regret it!
Download series #8. Just an effortlessly smooth version all around; great vocals and flowing leads from jerry. The epitome of all that is fall '73.
A more rocking version than others from the time, and oddly overlooked. Jumps off Cat right away into the long transition. Energetic stuff here.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Hard to go wrong with any selection from this outstanding show.  It takes a while for Rider to find its groove, but this is why we love the Dead!!
Crackling with energy. Tight as a single drummer.
Underrated show and a powerhouse version
very heady version

performances.venue: Blossom Music Center Cuyahoga Falls, OH
performances.description: Best peppyest version I have ever heard. Jerry doesn't miss a beat, his phrasing is decisive, accurate, and articulate. Some of Jerrys best playin !
Jerry tears his way into a very climatic Feelin' Groovy jam...
Twangy on top and chubby below. Phil's mighty sonics in the second break of CCS could be dangerous--don't listen to this while ice fishing!
the china cat is very hot
Great one here from this epic tour!
Killer transitional jam without FG.  Gives it more heat.  Not to be missed.

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Jazzy and sweet as sugar. Unique stuff from Bob.
Super extended China Cat!  SBD cuts out hard in a few places, but the awesomeness of this version simply cannot be stopped
Breezy like a warm summer day
Very extended version with long, meandering Garcia solos.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: This cooks hot.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Extremelly high energy fantastic band crowd interaction, this is an amazing pairing. Phil and Jerry are dominating this version.
Check out the power on this one. Bobby even rips a cool solo.  Jerry just thrashes the segue an amazing pairing.
Nice and loose jammin'
Another magical rendition in Reno.  Give this a whirl, you will not be disappointed.  The China outro is fantastic!!!

performances.venue: Indianapolis State Fair Coliseum Indianapolis, IN
performances.description: Another dynamite, joyous transition into rider. Feelin' Groovy jam is one of the best I've ever heard!!

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Fierce ChinaCat!!
China Cat is a slow, bumpy, and chaotic mess, quickly ended. Follows a beautiful Feeling Groovy and long Rider. Good to see the boys quick recovery!

performances.venue: Rec Hall, Penn State U State College, PA
performances.description: The final jam goes at least once more around than usual. Weir is strumming like a mad man and Lesh as many power chords, great version.RT Vol. 3 No. 4

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Awesome jam
Ripping primal Dead version. The transition is absolutely choatic with everyone barelling ahead like a northbound train into Rider! DP's 16
Awesome version.  Bob basically takes lead on the transition.  Pretty cool playing by him.  Worth a listen.
Pretty unique for the Europe '72 tour, interesting rendition, the China Cat is good, the I know you rider is probably just average for Euro '72
How is this not listed!! Phil bombs away!! The whole band is rollicking here. I think its just an all around fantastic version.
China>IKYPhil - both are a treat Jer goes bananas before the last verse of Rider.
Unique transition jam with a two-chord quarter-note striking pattern before IKYR. Band hits its stride in the set here.
January 1970...Hawaii...what more could anyone hope for?

performances.venue: Davis Gym, Bucknell University Lewisburg, PA
performances.description: The circulating source has some static in it but the China->Rider is nice.
Great stuff here. From a monster show, this is a really strong china < rider. One of the best of the era imho
This whole show needs some love. Don't be discouraged by the uneven quality of the tapes/SBDs!
One of the best of the year

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: ATTENTION MIDI LOVERS
Sweet version from an overlooked show.
Another bouncy silky smooth jam - tasty one here.
Nice interesting Jam, real unique sounding at times.
How in the world did this fall through the cracks?
Solid Europe 72 ~SBD Charlie & Rob
Qucik and Jazzy, HUGE Feelin' Groovy jam peak into Rider
SOOOOOOO SWEEEEEETTTTTTTTT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

performances.venue: San Diego Sports Arena San Diego, CA
performances.description: Smoking China Cat!
UVA.  Sick, sick sick.  Heavy brent and Garcia in mix; solid start; ramps up right in the middle of the jam and carries thru to rider.  So great.
If this hard grooving China jam and Feeling Groovy transition doesn't just get you moving, then nothing can. Just perfect.
just listen for yourself (especially if you don't normally venture past the "70's" like myself)

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: A cheesy video of this kickass version would have Garcia playing atop a steam locomotive as it barrels down the track.
Sick extended jaminess reminds us how much of a kick in the ass Hornsby gave Jerry
Superb, flowing, and near-perfect transition
Cosmic place, cosmic jams....Jerry fanned us nicely before the last verse
highlight of the 10 year field trip reunion
Gotten good mileage outta this one the last few months.
The DP 35 houseboat tapes version is very hot for '71. Great interplay between the band, Phil Bombs.
Gar c
One of the best of the 80's, the peak keeps going and going. Best indoor venue ever!!!!
Smooth firey build up to an epic Feelin' Groovy
Blissful, otherworldly, mellow (but intense) transition...why wasn't this on the Dick's Picks?!?!
Incomplete, but what remains is top-notch and essential.
Uncategorizably brilliant transition jam. Sweet sweet Rider. Overshadowed by the immortal PITB that follows. Give a spin, it won't disappoint.

performances.venue: Texas Christian University Fort Worth, TX
performances.description: Heady
73 Bliss
Rider is draggy/borderline asleep, but China Cat deserves to be listed. Only song left out from this fine Europe '72 sleeper?
Subtly experimental transition jam seems to hint at “Feelin’ Groovy” without stating the theme outright.
I know jerry's voice was shot most of 85' but this Fall run and particulary this China->Rider are knockouts
ChinaCat>Rider>Promised to close this Killer 1st set!!!!!!!
Best version post 74 that I know of...
Another great 1980 China> Rider, from one of the best Pre-Drum sets ever.  Smokin’, Give it a listen.
If you want to hear something sweet from 1984, check this out!!!
Overlooked. No peace-and-love version, this is rock and freaking roll.  The transition to Ryder is pure shredding genius.
Controlled yet passionate. Almost Mozartean.
sweet
Very rock n version lots of Jerry and Brent GREAT transition great peaking jams in Rider. W/ Hornsby guesting
Clean, professional and on point jammin' here - Jer is thowin' trills and fills here - awesome. (Source:CM)

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: China>Rider '82 stylings - no hurry offense - just some sweet pickin'. Source:CM

performances.venue: Assembly Hall, University Of Illinois Champaign, IL
performances.description: Rippin' C>R from when they were first starting to open it up...'73 goodness.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: '70 was a great time for China cat> riders. Check this version from a night with the family dog. Pretty sure there's video you can find
Intense early one with that rockin 1970 sound.
In the pocket '73 here, with flourishes throughout
Crazy overlooked: A noble, splendiferous C>R in full Europe 72-ness. Patient, exploratory, charming. Driving a distance? Pack this.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Jerry really, really wishes he was a headlight on a NB trai - ayyyyyyyain...and the band follows right along.
NO OTHER WAY TO END THE 1ST SET!!!!!!!!!

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Any 82' Dead is good to me!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY

performances.description: Maybe the most polished version of the decade ,Garcia's singing is gorgous and the >into High Time is awesome.

performances.venue: Silva Hall, Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: This is a killer. Definitely one of best of 83' this version is pure magic. Just listen to this china jam, you will be blown away.
Pretty good China followed by the best 80's OR 90's RIDER I've ever heard. Check Jer's run going into "sun gonna shine" verse. 5 stars fo RIDER alone.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: China starts out rough, with some missed lyrics, but the transition is amazing, and JG's vocals are tops: he even sings along with BW on his line!

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: The surviving tape has some issues, but this is a powerful version.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: Great version
part of spectacular pre drums China->Rider, Eyes->Sailor->Saint
Piercing China cat intro with some cool cymbal work, ripping Jerry through the whole tune Hot version

performances.venue: Downs of Santa Fe Santa Fe, NM
performances.description: Bright, uptempo version with Jerry on fire throughout

performances.venue: Glenns Falls Civic Center Glenns Falls, NY
performances.description: Right through the cracks!!! This is a CRAZY good PITB check it out at once

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Arena Oakland, CA
performances.description: A rip rockin' version of China>rider with a peaked transition and the best yelled headlight I've heard.

performances.venue: Lusk Field House - State University Of New York Cortland, NY
performances.description: Cool version

performances.venue: Marin County Veterans Auditorium San Rafael, CA
performances.description: My favorite “Wish I was a Headlight”, if you knew this version, you would vote.  Give it a listen.

performances.venue: Park West Ski Resort Park City, UT
performances.description: China>Rider>Scarlet>Fire up tempo bouncy China Rider
PUMPING !

performances.venue: Rochester Community War Memorial Rochester, NY
performances.description: Totally overlooked show, but blazing hot and extraordinary jams. Everything here that make '73 what it is.
Classic '73 China->Jam->Rider with tight harmonies and Wall of Sound clarity. Released as Dick's Picks 28.
When the going gets weird, Weir sings the headlight part.
INSANELY HOT!!! Jerry absolutely rips this apart.
The band is simply on fire. Give it a listen.
This one is a beut.  They torch the China Cat!  The Rider aint to shabby either.
My only rec from anything out of '70 - this entire show has special place in my heart
Top 10 of ALL time..... Jerry is flying
Brent lends the transition jam a relaxed fusion vibe. Dreamlike, but doesn't lose precision.
really odd transition the Jerry reverses headlight verse with Bob's Back door verse. Don't think it was intentional but added to the uniqueness
Impossible not to smile during this RIDER - Jerry is downright FRISKY and does not disappoint!
Jerry gives these vocals that extra little something. They are on this version well played and tightly jammed
Red rocks always sweet to hear the cool colorado rain line of rider at red rocks gives me chills just thinking about it.
Hot version the piercing notes Jerry plays during the transition cut through you like daggers! Absolutely HOT!!!!
Voice shot, Garcia hums through his spidery 13 lb. guitar. With a lovely China Cat peak @4:30.
Bruce Hornsby Goes Off!
High energy!  Please oh please where are the better sound quality versions?  Where are the boards?
Long fast and beautiful China jam to open 2nd set.  Forgotten show?  Check it out, heads, you won't regret it.
Really great version that's tight and captures the audience's excitement
Beautiful guitar work by Jerry throughout!
This “I know you Rider” has one on the tightest, most energetic closing jams you have ever heard.  Not a well know show, give it a listen.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Most people like the 13th ( I get it Darkstar!!! ) but this show is just as strong............
Off the Fillmore 69 Bonus Disc.  Great version, but different from 2/13 or 2/14.
Crazy good transition and phil bombs in rider. Band is on tonight

performances.venue: Terminal Island Correctional Facility San Pedro, CA
performances.description: Philzone masterclass. Hot and tight jam, the Rider three-part harmonies sound like some of the acoustic versions from the previous year.

performances.venue: Madison Sq Garden New York, NY
performances.description: SMOKING!! Criminal that it's not received mention Do NOT MISS!!
Country metal RIDER - they crush it '71 style great vocals on point, jamming is spikey and clean
Great mid set version
Fantastic early pairing dipped in acid
Very DIFFERENT intro to CCS transition jam is sweet into a short Rider
These both pop with some strong east coast energy. Source:CM
Great version! Great-sounding '72 soundboard

performances.venue: Glen Helen Regional Park Devore, CA
performances.description: US Festival gig. Straight to the point mini-jams.
Excellent bridge.  The band extends and extends and never loses their way.  Very heady version.
Bill jazzes on throughout the transition, and the jam goes just a little bit furhter than before. Cool version with a laid back IKYR.
Sweet version with an innovative transition.  The whole band was on, but Keith and Phil are high in the mix and brilliant..
Solid version.  Phil in the mix. Follows up a Red Rooster that starts 2nd set.  Good show all around.

performances.venue: Dean Smith Center - University of North Carolina Chapel Hill, NC
performances.description: If you haven't heard this one, check it out. One of the last truly great ones.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York City, NY
performances.description: OutStanding version and TC is very loud and clear
Punctilious transition; fine Rider solos around different verse placement
SMMMMMMOKIN’!!!!

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: first set and this version is smokin'
Classic China-Rider from a great run. 9/18/87 is legendary, but this show, and a lot of the shows from this tour, just as fantastic.

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Shocked this isn't listed here yet. Played at lightning speed, coked to the gills, but hits all the right spots. Incredible for an '81 version.
first set version bubbly and good
All four of my fav Jer China/Rider solos in one version. I like it better than 72 Veneta, 73 Boston, 90 MSG, etc. It weaves and goes to the heights.

performances.venue: Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Very strong.................what a way to end the 1st set!
Unbelievable pre-drums sequence
Starts off sloppy, but the jam and especially rider ROCK! Jerry actually became a headlight on a northbound train. True Story.
Laid-back yet rich and full. Well worth a listen!!!
Maybe the most polished version of the decade ,Garcia's singing is gorgous and the >into High Time is awesome.
pretty slick later version

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: Hot as hell show.
Virtuoso performance, the transition builds like a speeding river as it reaches a waterfall. There's a short tape gap in Rider, though, its all good.
The transition jam is so hot it could melt your flesh right off!
This one is all about the transition jam and the beautiful Rider that follows. Led by Phil Jerry and Bobby the transition is especially hot.
Fast rocking China Cat briskly moves into a hot quick paced I know You Rider. Brent and Jerry are on fire here.
Ripping fast paced and high energy. From a killer high octane first set.
Another spectacular late 79 China Rider, went on a 79 binge last night Brent fit in right away.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Nice jammin here - Jer's back and there's some pep here.
Posted mostly for the killer China Cat that has a great extended jam before going into the Rider.

performances.venue: Silva Hall, Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: Double Headlight verse on the way out of Rider...Jer with a feelin!
Finely jammed - but no Bob in the mix.

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Strong transition with Bob catching the groove. They just seem to stretch things out oh so nicely with Keith on the keys. Jer is on point.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: unheralded standout from MSG hot rocking Brent era China->Rider

performances.venue: Park West Ski Resort Park West, UT
performances.description: Phil teases whole lotta love by Zeppelin then they launch into a funky China cat

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Beautiful jam and transition. The mix shows off Bobby nicely, which is rare for the era. His contribution is beautiful here.  Enjoy.
Hot fast paced rocker to close out the set on the 4th. Speedy but still jam packed

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Crystal clear sound and tight show opener in this hot hot pre-Europe run. The vocals are on and the transition rocks.
Unfortunate cut in CC, but the Rider is tremendous.  Needs a cleanup bad - Paging Mr. Miller, help out please!
Smooth transition
Groovy opening to a great show
Brilliant, crisp ideas and tight ensemble playing on a warm Bear AUD. Just exactly perfect.

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: This CC is so sweet and much longer than others of the era before signaling the >IKYR, with lots of room to stretch out and find the sound.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: A strong performance by Vince highlights the transitional jam.
Surprised not to see this here.  The trans has extra oomph to it and the band sails along in perfect sync. Great fun.
Reminded me of "Linus and Lucy" in some places - Pristine!

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Fire
Flexes some '88 muscle
Shocked this crisp, clean Spring 1990 version has not been submitted.

performances.venue: Autzen Stadium - University of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: Don’t let the beginning fool you, this is a fantastic set two opener. Everyone gets their share here. Down home pickin’ from Jerry. Great stuff.
last show of a 4 night run in Hotlanta.  Very lengthy version with long transition
Hard to beat this one.
Another killer version, even with the cut in the tape this one never ceased to please!!!

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Cumberland County Civic Center, Portland, ME
Snazzy light and tight. China's melody is a traipsing psychadelic counterpoint, a perfect trans into Rider. Good vibes.
One of those rare ones where China Cat plods a bit and they move into a blazing hot Rider.  Great show all around, too.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Grab a brew and turn the volume up, all the way up!!!
It's possible there are 73-74 versions that don't belong on the list but this is defenitly not one of them.
an amazing 1970 china>rider- classic! make sure you listen to this version
only UJB》China》Ryder ☆☆☆☆☆
I think Jerry's working ideas out in new places in the fretboard during the "China" solo, and Brent is contributing some interesting colors.
transition into Rider is great, Weir's chops are great keeping right there with Jerry.
wow 200 versions and this one is not on here, great version!!
FANTASTIC version from Europe 1990. Cleaner sounding than 9/20/90 and easily holds it own with other 90's versions. HIGHLY UNDERATED SHOW!!!
Nice warp speed version with Jerry furiously firing off notes during the transition pretty cool, very fast tempo on both China and Rider
Nice early pairing from the Boston Tea Party, way more psychedelic than later versions,

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Auditorium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Extremely high energy version the momentum builds through out the combo, the northbound train segment is goose-bump inducing. Brilliant transition

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Wonderful pairing one of the best Wish I was a headlight passages out there please go listen if you have not heard it fantastic
Huge surprise for an encore on this evening
China Cat Sunflower-> I Know You Rider-> C.C. Rider what a wonderful crazy jamfest. Brent and Jerry are especially on here just destroying it.

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: They clearly came to jam this night - everyone drank from the same cup. Lively, clear lines and great interplay.
Short Cat, but very interesting transition, with Bobby driving in all his angular beauty, followed by a tight jamming Rider.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: A hot run through tight jammy Brent on fire here.
Delicious loads of killer Brent key work and Jerry is sublime lyrically and with the axe. Transition COOKS with GAS
Chilled out combo for NYE and it's super sweet.
Super dual guitar attack on the CC and I think Bob plays lead for a bit.

performances.venue: East Hall, Franklin & Marshall College Lancaster, PA
performances.description: Solid china > rider

performances.venue: Rubber Bowl - University of Akron Akron, OH

performances.description: KGs new here but just listen to he n Billy team up n lead the charge..
3 from vault killer version
Tight, nice CC. Seems like 1st moment of the set the band is firing on all cylinders. Trans. stretches to great IKYR.
High-powered and tight.  This show has nothing but complaints about the mix on the archive. Listen to the Ashley transfer, and see what you've missed.
From Download Series #2, clean, tight, high quality

performances.venue: Santa Cruz County Fairgrounds Watsonville, CA
performances.description: Absolutely en fuego!
Why no love for this great show?  It isn't one of the top 10 for the year - but it's '72 and they're flowing just exactly perfect.

performances.venue: School Gymnasium, S.U.N.Y. Stony Brook, NY
performances.description: fantastic early china->rider. Jam segment is flawless with great licks from Bobby flowing into a short little repetitive Jerry lick smooth into rider.
Jerry and Bobby on fire

performances.venue: San Jose state university  San jose,
performances.description: Great early china rider coming out of cryptical
Really strong version. Jerry's vocals are particularly sharp and playful here. Bobby and Brent deliver big here.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Slice of '73, great Bob and Keith in transition; seems like cleaner copy is in vault...
Rollickin'!
From 30 Days of Dead 2017. Vince's caliope sound hurts, but Jerry and especially Bob are brilliant here. Hard not to notice Weir on this one.

performances.venue: Felt Forum, Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Late '71 goodness
This spicy version won't blow any minds but closes out a totally solid and enjoyable first set. Jerry's got the spices flowing for the Rider solo.
phil feels at home in Rochester
Tons of energy in this one..CRISPY..Played in a special place MERRIWEATHER!!
Over the Top - Highlight of Show - BRENT!!!!!
From my first tape I ever had--listen to Jerry rip during the bridge, Jerry & Bobby switch verses during Rider...
Solid smooth jamming on China Cat for a solid, beautiful 8 mins, including the FGJ. Rider has Phil high in the vocal mix, to a very nice effect.
One of the best later versions.
An epic version during the EPIC Hampton 88 run...
CCS is supremely tight, with a bit of that '69 magic sound to it, and IKYR rocks. Followed by a Stephen, so maybe some nostalgia? Sounds great.
Jerry has an interesting final jam that he rips at the end of China Cat.  He also shreds at the end of Rider , too.
Primal shredding in transition, complete fire from start to finish

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: epic version, this whole show rips!

performances.venue: San Antonio Civic Auditorium San Antonio, TX

performances.description: Scorcher to open set 2, blistering guitar from Jerry, The segue is Fantastic and full of Jerry, very Heady version

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Very tigh a hot pairing of the oft played duo, loads of energy and a sweet segue.
Ripper to end a really hot set 1. emerges brilliantly from a nice LL rain
Crystal clear version, not sure why it's been overlooked.  Beautiful vocals, great recording, indicative of the transition sound of the era.
With Bruce Hornsby
Another standout version from 1972 whole show has the extra spark

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: The CC and transition soar, and part of an Alligator>D>TOO>Attisc>TOO>C.Ch.>Good Lovin'>D.>China>Rider>Good Lovin' über set. Rider is cut, tho.
Another hot one from early in Brent's tenure with the band
excellent versin from an unheralded show the Miller SNBd is gorgeous as per usual: https://archive.org/details/gd1972-03-22.132726.sbd.miller.flac16
Fastest freaking China>Rider I've ever heard! Musta been that Seatle coffee ;)
Multigen sound quality, but unmistakenly tight jam with a sweet transition.

performances.venue: McDonough Arena - Georgetown University Washington, DC
performances.description: Fun, tight version with great energy and tight vocals.  Fun stuff.
Wow this was over 20 years ago.Tough ticket spent all day with my finger in the air. got tik 5 minutes before show!!!
Notable for the "miracle beer" Bobby passes around to launch the song. "Everybody just wet your tongue". Okaaaaaay.
Jerry's headlight did not disappoint the Boston crowd

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: This one is the sound of a band that knows it can do pretty much anything.  Smooth and fiery.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Fast, rocking China with a soaring solo and a lively transition, too bad Rider is cut though.
Sweet version to end the set, Jerry sounds great.
Damn! Unhealthy JG really kicks ass sometimes! Excellent bouncy >, Jer sings along in 'laid down last night.' verse - Rider is simply out for blood!

performances.venue: Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Look for the Bear recording, which is the proper speed: You'll find a killer version with an explosive transition than just soars.
They all shine
More '71 vitamins...
Coked out or not, this one is fast and hot late in the OKC summer

performances.venue: sf civic ctr san francisco, ca
performances.description: Speedy, energetic, and a lot of fun! Love this 2nd set opener.
There's no fooling around with this one.
Just ferocious by the end of Rider, but there’s lots to enjoy all the way through this combo.

performances.venue: Yale Bowl, Yale University New Haven, CT
performances.description: Listened to this on a big PA outside over the summer and it's so alive, athletic, and filled with beautiful instrumental cross-talk. Improv!

performances.venue: Cal Expo, Building A Sacramento, CA
performances.description: Great raw '69 version full of energy and fast playing
Very crisp, driving version with nice work from Brent.
Watching that stream thing, this is really good

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Kind of shocked so many songs from this show hadn't been nominated...top-notch '72 IMO, and this China>Rider is no exception...
Jerrys emotion brings tears

performances.venue: Pine Knob Music Theater Clarkston, MI
performances.description: Perfect!!!
Mega show here folks. Bobby's high in the mix and driving the train.  The China's fine, but the Rider kicks serious ass.

performances.venue: Field House, U. of Cincinnati Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: Jerry stumbles a bit during the transition, but a powerful early version.
Great vocals and wild harmony with a sweet jam from an historically important show.

performances.venue: Saenger Performing Arts Center New Orleans, LA
performances.description: fast tight loads of energy

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Wow this was a fun one, Spirited playing and nice Jerry and Vince playing off one another, just as hot as the vegas sun.

performances.venue: San Francisco Civic Auditorium San Francisco, CA
performances.description: A stellar version to close out set one. works so well as a set one closer. Very hot high energy rendition. Fast paced China cat and the ending rider
Jammy the final jam is really a rocking ripping jam fest.
Hot opener to the first electric set. Excellent 3 set show overall
Excellent China Rider following a spirited Bucket to open set 2 in PA's capitol. Hot Pairing
Unexpected hotness from an era where they are building tremendous steam.
Killer version sweet spacey China Cat
Souped up high voltage versions here. The CC has that rippin' '69 energy and the vocals throughout nail it.

performances.venue: Santa Rosa Fairgrounds Santa Rosa, CA
performances.description: Loving the 1970 China-Riders.
Vintage Dead
Wow best China cat>rider up to this point in the year. Really good early one. Spin it
lads into the rhythm devils interesting position and a real nice performance
Great C > R. Jerry and Bobby on fire in the bridge, Phil nice and loud in the Rider portion, just check it out, you'll be surprised.

performances.venue: Milwaukee Performing Arts Center Milwaukee, WI
performances.description: Great transition into Rider here.  Really strong '72 ensemble playing.  Sound quality is only about a B though.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Wow, just excellent, Jerry playling like you would associate with 84-85! How many times did they open with C>R?
The amp tubes are glowing white-hot and the Boys are not letting up. Face-meltingly hot.
It starts off slow, then the booogie kicks in and this one sprouts its wings and soars.
Lately I think of Port Chester. Fab 4 Alignment. Limber. Ambidextrous.
Fast but very neat and tight. Cool version from the best run of 1986.
This one's a blast. The last minute of "China" is just crazy interplay.
Excellent early version
Hey, check this one out!
A lively, crisp set closer, with shades of the super-sized blowout on 3/9
A sprawling and celebratory 2nd set opener to a fantastic under the radar show from 1987

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Only one tape on archive… yes! Bouncy, steamrollin’ ‘70.
The forth live performance of these 2 songs put together. It starts out a little rough, then it evolves into a well paced and played China Rider.
Exploratory transition jam! Very different from most early versions. Has that anarchic ’60s energy.
Solid early 80's version.  Groovin' transition jam
Movin' and groovin'
March winds gonna blow.... Classic late 809s version. Followed by excellent Blow Away.
Builds into a really great Rider

performances.venue: Laguna Seca Recreation Area Monterey, CA
performances.description: China>Crazy>Rider!! Insane
One of the longest jams into rider I've heard. That combined with the overall '74 sound makes it a killer version.
a real treat for the alaskan deadheads
A pretty jazzed version
Clean and nimble first-set closer

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: The original Psychedelic version
Simply put, incredible. Second one after Brent's death, Vince only still. Really excellent playing on everyone's part, even Vince is trying to dig in

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Wow! Smokin! Jerry whips up an amazing transition before crossing into Rider. Playing is tight and fast. Heady af!
Absurdly good!

performances.venue: Pine Knob Music Theater Clarkston, MI
performances.description: Perfect!!!
Jerry's just on fire throughout this whole show. They jam the beginning for a while before the first verse at a nice, brisk clip.
Very strong Rider particularly the northbound train segment.
Lyrics on Jamming hot garcia high up in the mix.  Highlight of the Run
Nice version from a nice final year show
It's tough to beat harg the cool colorado rain line while in Colorado, haeday version highlight of the evening, loads of energy, Welcome Back

performances.venue: The Palestra, U. of Rochester Rochester, NY
performances.description: Nice warm AUD for the era, with a sparkling CCS and great transition into IKYR.
This one really rocks it has some crazy magic. Unheralded
From Dick's Picks Vol. 20. Energetic china cat, good transition, smooth harmonies on Rider and Jerry really delivers the train headlight verse
Overlooked, patient little gemerald.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: How did this escape our attention for so long? Excellent, high energy version. Solid transition. Rider keeps it going strong.
Jerry does everything in this Rider, especially in his final solo.
Kinda mellow but kinda groovy. Nice northbound train vocals

performances.venue: Polo Field, Golden Gate Park San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Jerry lays down some sweet licks in "IKYR."

performances.venue: Freeborn Hall, University of California Davis, CA
performances.description: Ah, early '71

performances.venue: Irvine Meadows Amphitheatre Laguna Hills, CA
performances.description: Tasty Jerry licks in this version.  Has one of those “moments” during the Rider solo.. check it out !!
Great early China > Rider! Boys are in tune here with a great China Cat jam and transition into I Know You Rider
From the audience side - really gets swirling
Have always loved the San Venetia tapes - almost like an x-ray of the GD. You can so hear the guitar architecture. So tempted to make that one word.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Auditorium Oakland, CA
performances.description: This version has a nice swing to it. Speedy and good energy in the > Rider segue
Great 1970 version
Real neat and short early version of the combo. Worth checking out

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Smokes to end set 1. Dead always shine in Alpine!

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Plenty of passion
Second set opener
Well performed second set opener
Pretty effin' great

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Are you serious? Absolute burner, kicks off the second set. Check this out. I'm about to replay it.
Inspired late era version with some stellar Jerry licks.
An interesting early version!

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
Cafe au Go-Go New York, NY
performances.description: The very first time they were played back to back (that we can confirm)!Surprised not to see this!
A bouncy one
Right down the middle
Music plays Hornsby and band as all are on point and with abundance of energy.
Really smooth version, Jerry has a lot of fun on the northbound train.
Bouncy as it is lysergic. Unique phrasing from Jerry. Everybody’s vocals are on. The Rider is some pure country fried jamming if I’ve ever heard it.
